## Projects  {.tabset} 

### 2020

**Bayesian classification of multivariate time series using vine copula** (joint work with Prof. [Claudia Czado](https://www.groups.ma.tum.de/statistics/personen/claudia-czado/))

---------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------
We introduce a vine copula based approach to                           <input type="image" src="images/Figure-png-small2.png" alt="Submit" width="148" height="148">
analyze multivariate time series exhibiting complex dependence
structures as well as nonstationary behavior dependence, and employ 
Bayesian classifier to perform classification. 
This approach will be applied to time
series derived from  a neural activity experiment to 
classify the opening and closing of the eyes. The performance 
to other classification methods will be investigated.  

---------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------

**Dependence Modeling and Bayesian Reliability Analysis for Competing Risks Data**

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dependent competing risks model is widespread in relaibility analysis  
of products or systems. It is of importance to capture the dependence information of failure causes.
We apply vine copula to model the complex dependence relationship and assess the reliability based on Bayesian framework.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
